articles.title: Brazil's Bolsonaro to break silence after election defeat
articles.description: Some supporters are refusing to recognise the result, and have set-up roadblocks across the country.
articles.content:
Brazil's far-right president, Jair Bolsonaro, is expected to speak in the coming hours - breaking the silence he has maintained since being defeated in Sunday's presidential election.

articles.title: 'Tell me this ain't true' - reaction as rapper Takeoff shot dead
articles.description: Takeoff, of hip hop trio Migos, was shot dead at a bowling alley in Houston, Texas, in the early hours of the morning.
articles.content:
Takeoff's last post on Instagram, posted less than 19 hours ago, has received an outpouring of comments from fans and artists well-known in the American rapping scene.

articles.title: Takeoff: Migos rapper shot dead in Houston, reports say
articles.description: The star, whose group found fame with hits like Bad and Boujee and Stir Fry, was 28 years old.
articles.content:
Rapper Takeoff, from the chart-topping band Migos, has been shot and killed in Houston, according to US media reports.

articles.title: US court blocks Penguin merger with Simon & Schuster
articles.description: US District Judge Florence Pan said the deal could "substantially" lessen competition in the market.
articles.content:
A US court has blocked a $2.2bn (£1.9bn) merger between the world's largest book publisher Penguin Random House and its rival Simon & Schuster.
